#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>

int main() {
    int n, m;
    scanf("%d %d", &n, &m);
    
    // Compute array a
    int a[m];
    if (n % m == 0) {
        int val = n / m;
        for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
            a[i] = val;
        }
    } else {
        int sub = n / m;
        int test = n - sub * m;
        for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
            a[i] = sub;
        }
        int count = 0;
        for (int i = 0; i < test; i++) {
            a[count] += 1;
            count++;
            if (count >= m) count = 0; // Fix the condition here
        }
    }
    
    // Get the first element of reversed array (a[m-1])
    int first_element = a[m-1];
    
    // Convert to string
    char s[20];
    sprintf(s, "%d", first_element);
    
    // Process for a1 and a2
    int a1 = 0;
    char a_str[strlen(s)+1];
    strcpy(a_str, s);
    for (int i = 1; i < strlen(a_str); i++) {
        if (a_str[i] == a_str[i-1]) {
            a_str[i] = (a_str[i] == '1') ? '0' : '1';
            a1++;
        }
    }
    
    int a2 = 0;
    char b_str[strlen(s)+1];
    strcpy(b_str, s);
    for (int i = strlen(b_str)-1; i > 0; i--) {
        if (b_str[i] == b_str[i-1]) {
            b_str[i-1] = (b_str[i-1] == '1') ? '0' : '1';
            a2++;
        }
    }
    
    int min_val = (a1 < a2) ? a1 : a2;
    
    // Count the number of 1s in binary representation of min_val
    int count = 0;
    int temp = min_val;
    if (temp == 0) {
        count = 0;
    } else {
        while (temp > 0) {
            count += temp & 1;
            temp >>= 1;
        }
    }
    
    printf("%d\n", count);
    
    return 0;
}
